title: Integrate beads as backend for OpenCode todo tools
description:
Replace OpenCode's built-in todowrite/todoread tools with custom plugin implementations that use beads as the persistence layer. This enables todo lists to survive session disconnects and context compaction while keeping the TUI sidebar functional.

Architecture: Beads is source of truth, OpenCode todos are a projection synced via file watching.

Key components:
- BeadsTodoAdapter (CRUD mapping)
- File watcher for .beads/issues.jsonl
- Schema mapping (status, priority, content)
- Session tagging for scoping
- Write-through to bd CLI + projection refresh

Benefits:
- Todos survive session disconnects
- Structured ephemeral tracking with dependencies
- Bi-directional sync (CLI changes reflected in UI)
- Recovery from context compaction
close_reason: All subtasks complete. todowrite/todoread overrides implemented with tool.execute.after hook for sidebar compatibility. Awaiting manual testing after OpenCode restart.

title: Design session-to-beads mapping strategy
description:
Define how OpenCode todos map to beads issues.

DESIGN:
- Session issue created on first todowrite call with session ID in title
- Each todo becomes a child issue with parent-child relationship
- Todo ID stored in beads issue metadata for bidirectional mapping
- Mapping cached in .beads/opencode-todo-mapping.json for speed
- Priority mapping: high→1, medium→2, low→3

ACCEPTANCE:
- [ ] Session issue created on first todowrite call
- [ ] Todo items become child issues with parent-child link
- [ ] Todo ID stored in beads for recovery
- [ ] Local mapping file for fast lookups
close_reason: Mapping strategy designed and implemented in todo-sync.ts: session issues as epics, todos as children, mapping file at .beads/opencode-todo-mapping.json

title: Implement todowrite override plugin tool
description:
Override built-in todowrite with plugin tool that syncs to beads.

DESIGN:
- Plugin tool named 'todowrite' overrides built-in (last-write-wins)
- Must return EXACT format for ACP sidebar compatibility:
  { title, output: JSON.stringify(todos), metadata: { todos } }
- Sync logic: create session issue, create/update child issues
- Session issues auto-close when all children complete
- Add summary notes to session issue

EVIDENCE (from exploration):
- registry.ts: plugins loaded after built-ins
- prompt.ts line 589: tools[item.id] = ... (last wins)
- acp/agent.ts lines 214, 538: parses tool output for sidebar

ACCEPTANCE:
- [ ] Plugin tool named 'todowrite' registered
- [ ] Returns exact format expected by ACP
- [ ] Syncs todos to beads (create/update/close)
- [ ] Sidebar shows correct todo count
- [ ] Session issue auto-closes when complete
notes:
DISCOVERY: Plugin tools get metadata:{} from fromPlugin wrapper, BUT tool.execute.after hook receives mutable result object. We can mutate output.metadata and output.title in the hook AFTER our tool executes.

SOLUTION: Override + Hook Combo
1. Override todowrite with plugin tool (executes beads sync)
2. Add tool.execute.after hook to populate metadata.todos and title
3. Sidebar renders correctly because metadata is set before return

EVIDENCE: prompt.ts lines 630-639 show hook runs before result is returned
close_reason: Implemented todowrite override with tool.execute.after hook for metadata/title fixup. Tool syncs to beads, hook ensures sidebar compatibility.

title: Implement todoread override plugin tool

- Return same format as native todoread
